com.complexible.stardog.virtual.api

Class CSVMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complexible.stardog.virtual.api.CSVMapper

  • public class CSVMapper
extends Object
    Converts a CSV file to RDF based on the given mappings.
    Since:
    4.0
    Version:
    4.0
    Author:
    Evren Sirin

      Maps the contents of a CSV file to RDF using the given mappings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVMapper

        public CSVMapper()

    • Method Detail

      • isHeader

        public boolean isHeader()
        Returns true if the header row is enabled for the mapper. When headers are enabled the first row of the input file is used to retrieve the column names and mappings can refer to those column names.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(boolean theHeader)
        Enables or disables headers for the mapper. Default value is true.

      • getSeparator

        public char getSeparator()
        Returns the separator character that will used by the mapper.

      • setSeparator

        public void setSeparator(char theSeparator)
        Sets the character used to separate columns in a single line. Default value is ','.

      • getQuote

        public char getQuote()
        Returns the quote character for the mapper.

      • setQuote

        public void setQuote(char theQuote)
        Sets the character used to encapsulate values containing special characters. Default value is '"'.

      • getEscape

        public Character getEscape()
        Returns the escape character for the mapper.

      • setEscape

        public void setEscape(Character theEscape)
        Sets the character used to escape values containing special characters. Default value is null.

      • isSkipEmpty

        public boolean isSkipEmpty()
        Returns true if empty values in the CSV file will be skipped.

      • setSkipEmpty

        public void setSkipEmpty(boolean theSkipEmpty)
        Enables or disables skipping empty values in the CSV file. If true no triples will be generated for templates that refer to a column with empty value. Default value is true.

      • map

        public void map(Reader theReader,
                String theMappings,
                org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandler theHandler)
         throws IOException,
                org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandlerException,
                org.openrdf.rio.RDFParseException
        Maps the contents of a CSV file to RDF using the given mappings.
        Parameters:
        theReader - reader for the CSV file
        theMappings - String representation of mappings in Stardog Mapping Syntax
        theHandler - handler for processing the generated triples
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error reading the CSV file
        org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandlerException - if the handler throws an exception during processing
        org.openrdf.rio.RDFParseException - if there is an error parsing the mappings
